modules.description: Converts between string and Cstruct types, enabling efficient byte-level manipulation. Operates on custom string and Cstruct data structures, ensuring compatibility with low-level network protocols. Used to serialize and deserialize data in network communication and binary file handling.

Converts between custom string and Cstruct types, enabling low-level byte manipulation for network and file operations. Supports serialization and deserialization of data structures used in protocol implementation. Provides functions to pack and unpack binary data, allowing direct access to underlying byte sequences. Examples include encoding message headers, parsing binary file formats, and preparing data for network transmission.

Provides functions to create, parse, and manipulate content identifiers derived from cryptographic hashes, including encoding and hash function metadata. Works with byte sequences, hash digests, and structured data representing CID versions and multihash formats. Used to generate unique identifiers for data stored in distributed systems like IPFS, ensuring data integrity and referential consistency.

Constructs and manipulates content identifiers (CIDs) using version, multibase encoding, multicodec, and multihash components. Parses and serializes CIDs from and to strings and Cstruct buffers, with validation for multibase encodings. Compares CIDs for equality and formats them for human-readable output.
